docs.text:
Early Development

cudup is currently in early development, do not use it yet.

docs.title: cudup
docs.text:
The CUDA Version Manager

Easily install and switch between CUDA versions on Linux.

docs.title: What is cudup?
docs.text:
cudup is a command-line tool that simplifies managing multiple CUDA toolkit and cuDNN installations on your system.

  • Install multiple CUDA versions side-by-side
  • Switch between versions instantly
  • Manage per-project CUDA requirements

docs.title: System Requirements
docs.text:
• OS: Linux (Ubuntu 20.04+, Debian 11+)
  • Architecture: x86_64, ARM64 (SBSA)
  • Disk Space: ~10GB per CUDA version

docs.title: Roadmap
docs.text: Track development progress as features are implemented.

docs.title: MVP (v0.1)
docs.text:
• Install CUDA + cuDNN together (cudup install)
  • List available/installed versions (cudup list)
  • Switch between versions (cudup use)
  • Shell integration (cudup manage setup) (bash, zsh, fish)
  • Health diagnostics (cudup check)
  • Basic error handling and user-friendly messages
  • Linux support (Ubuntu/Debian)

docs.title: v0.5
docs.text:
• Per-project .cuda-version files (cudup local)
  • Show current version (cudup current)
  • Automatic cuDNN version matching
  • Uninstall versions (cudup uninstall)
  • Clean up old versions (cudup clean)
  • Diagnostics (runtime checks, GPU detection)
  • Show cudup version (cudup --version)
  • Checksum verification (SHA256 integrity checks)
  • Resumable downloads for large installers
  • Pre-flight compatibility checking (GPU driver, compute capability)

docs.title: v1.0
docs.text:
• NCCL support (--with-nccl)
  • TensorRT support (--with-tensorrt)
  • Framework compatibility checking (cudup check pytorch/tensorflow)
  • Configuration file support (~/.cudup/config.toml)
  • Self-update mechanism (cudup manage self-update)
  • Remote version manifest (fetch latest available versions)
  • Proxy configuration for corporate environments
  • PATH rollback support (cudup manage remove --rollback)
  • Advanced installation options (--minimal, --from-cache)
  • Global vs local version modes (cudup global)
  • Import existing installations (cudup import)
  • Export/import environments
  • Multi-architecture support (x86_64, ARM64/SBSA)
  • Multi-distro support (RHEL, CentOS, Fedora)
  • Performance optimizations (parallel downloads)
  • Comprehensive documentation
  • Automated testing suite

docs.title: Future Considerations
docs.text:
• WSL2 support
  • Native Windows support (if demand exists?)
  • Docker integration
  • Plugin system for extensions

docs.title: Commands Overview
docs.text:
cudup provides the following commands:

Command Description install Install a CUDA version uninstall Remove a CUDA version list List available CUDA versions use Activate a CUDA version check Verify cudup configuration local Use project-local CUDA version manage Manage cudup installation

docs.title: cudup check
docs.text: Verify cudup configuration and CUDA installation.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text: cudup check

docs.title: Output
docs.text:
cudup check

[✓] cudup directory: /home/you/.cudup
[✓] shell integration: env file exists
[✓] installed versions: 2 (12.4.1, 11.8.0)
[✓] active version: 12.4.1
[✓] nvcc: 12.4
[✓] nvidia driver: v550.54
[✓] gpu: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4090

All checks passed!

docs.title: Checks Performed
docs.text: Check Description cudup directory ~/.cudup exists shell integration ~/.cudup/env file exists installed versions Lists versions in ~/.cudup/versions/ active version CUDA_HOME is set and valid nvcc CUDA compiler is accessible nvidia driver Driver version via nvidia-smi gpu GPU detection via nvidia-smi

docs.title: cudup install
docs.text:
Install a specific CUDA version toolkit and the compatible cuDNN version.

All versions are installed to:

~/.cudup/versions/<version>/

docs.title: cudup list
docs.text: List available CUDA versions.

docs.title: cudup manage
docs.text: Manage cudup installation and shell integration.

docs.title: Subcommands
docs.text: Command Description setup Configure shell integration remove Remove shell integration self-update Update cudup to the latest version

docs.title: cudup manage setup
docs.text:
Configure shell integration for cudup.

  1. Detects your shell (bash, zsh, or fish)
  2. Creates ~/.cudup/env (or env.fish for fish) with the shell wrapper function
  3. Adds a source line to your shell config (.bashrc, .zshrc, or config.fish)

docs.title: cudup manage remove
docs.text:
1. Deletes ~/.cudup/env (or env.fish)
  2. Removes the cudup source line from your shell config

docs.title: cudup manage self-update (not implemented yet)
docs.text:
Update cudup to the latest version.

  • Download and install the latest cudup binary from GitHub releases
  • Binary integrity checks
  • Check for updates without installing (--check flag)

docs.title: cudup uninstall
docs.text:
Remove an installed CUDA version.

  • Asks for confirmation (unless --force is used)
  • Warns if uninstalling the currently active version

docs.title: cudup use
docs.text:
Activate a specific CUDA version in your current shell.

Sets the following environment variables in your current shell:

  • CUDA_HOME - Points to the CUDA installation
  • PATH - Adds CUDA binaries
  • LD_LIBRARY_PATH - Adds CUDA libraries

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text: This guide will get you up and running with cudup in a few minutes.

docs.title: 1. Setup Shell Integration
docs.text:
cudup manage setup

Restart your terminal or source your shell config:

source ~/.bashrc  # or ~/.zshrc or ~/.config/fish/config.fish

docs.title: 2. List Available Versions
docs.text:
cudup list

This shows all CUDA versions available for installation.

docs.title: 3. Install a CUDA Version
docs.text:
cudup install 12.4.1

This downloads and installs CUDA 12.4.1 along with a compatible cuDNN version.

docs.title: 4. Activate the Version
docs.text:
cudup use 12.4.1

This sets CUDA_HOME, PATH, and LD_LIBRARY_PATH for your current shell.

docs.title: 5. Verify
docs.text:
cudup check

You should see all checks passing:

cudup check

[✓] cudup directory: /home/you/.cudup
[✓] shell integration: env file exists
[✓] installed versions: 1 (12.4.1)
[✓] active version: 12.4.1
[✓] nvcc: 12.4
[✓] nvidia driver: v550.54
[✓] gpu: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4090

All checks passed!
